title: The phone has arrived!
body:
EDIT: The Pixel 2 has arrived, and I am happy to report that the case and all buttons fit perfectly. It does add a good grip and feel to the phone, without being large. The Pixel 2 is a small phone, so it's not as narrow as can be with the case, but it's close. Without the case, the pixel is 70mm wide. With the case, it is 73mm. This is a hair thinner than the more plasticized case from the competitor on my 5X, which still remains much more 'tough' feeling. That case makes the Nexus 5X jump from 72 to 77mm, 2.5mm on each side. So if thin with protection is your thing, this Rugged Armor should do the job nicely.
Side-note: The Pixel wasn't as slippery as I thought it would be. They did a great job texturing the back of the phone.

A background: I have several Spigen cases and screen covers on my phones and when it came time to get one for the new Pixel 2, the options were slim. Spigen did have this 'Rugged Armor' case ready for shipping now (before the phones fully arrive), and since the Slim Armor and Tough Armor models were not going to be ready for another couple weeks after release I did not want to take the chance of dropping my sure-to-be-slippery Pixel within a week of getting it. The Google cases are light cases, the cloth ones are nice looking but don't provide a lot of drop resistance, which I discovered on my old Nexus 6P. Thus, since this was one of the only options available for a reasonable sub-20$ price from a reputable manufacturer at the time, I went with this Rugged Armor case.
The Rugged Armor case is a light, flexible side and back bumper. It adds minimal thickness to the phone. It adds a roughly 1.5mm front edge to keep the display off the table and a thicker 2.0mm backing to cushion blows from the back. It's not rubbery at all, it's a little slick, but nothing like the metal edges of a phone. It has cutouts for the fingerprint scanner, camera, sensors for the camera, a mic port on the top and bottom, and the USB-C port. The power/volume buttons are covered partially... I'll upload a picture to demonstrate.
The biggest issues I have with this case is how flimsy the material feels and how it's called the 'Rugged Armor' model. I used to have a Slim Armor set from Spigen on my old Nexus 5. The base rubbery bumper (which then was held in place by a more solid reinforcing wrap) felt a little sturdier than this case... this one just seems like it will twist too easily. Compared to the slim armor or other single-piece cases I've used in this price range, it feels fairly flimsy and I'm not convinced that it adds any less bulk then some of the more sturdy material models. If I compare this rugged armor one-piece to a one-piece competing brand I use for my Nexus 5X, it's very obvious which one is more sturdy, and without necessarily adding thickness in key measurements.
Like mentioned, an additional concern I have is the naming. I'm not sure how long Spigen's been using the 'Rugged Armor' name but it sure sounds to me like something that would be STRONGER than the 'Tough Armor' and especially the 'Slim Armor' models. This one is definitely a step behind those two, and looking at prices now, the Tough Armor (not available yet) is only a couple bucks more than this one. I will be buying a Tough Armor one down the road and I plan to compare the two cases measurement-wise to see if you are really gaining 'slimness' by going with the Rugged Armor case. While this naming isn't really an issue, if this doesn't save a healthy amount of bulk over the Slim or Tough cases it's hard to justify why you'd want this instead.
At the end of the day it seems that it will definitely suffice in its mission: give me more friction to hold my new Pixel in place while a different case arrives, while costing a third of what Google wants for its swanky cloth cases. Plus, the carbon fiber pattern on the back is a nice touch.

tl;dr: I wanted to give this 4/5 because it doesn't appear to be a bad case and it's not proven anything yet (I don't even have a phone to put into it), but its floppiness disappoints me when sitting next to a competitor that housed my Nexus 5X.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body: The case has worked really really well, for the short time I have had it. The material seems to be pretty fingerprint and stain resistant. All in all, it is a pretty slick looking case and doesn't add too much volume to the phone, keeping it slim while still protecting the phone.

title: The phone has arrived!
body: I have been supporting this company and Diztronic for years. I have never been dissatisfied at their TPU cases. If you like to keep the case bloat down then this is the answer. Just enough protection and does not take away form the fact that you purchased a slim phone.

author.name: ByEmily Osburn

title: Great case for the price!
body: Great looking, plain yet classy. A perfect fit which you come to expect. This is the fourth Spigen case I have purchased for different phones and they all have been fine products. It should provide adequate protection if I need it. The price provides a great value!!

title: Solid contender.
body: Although the Pixel 2 is not "slippery", I always feel more comfortable with a case. The Spigen Rugged Armor Case fits the Pixel 2 perfectly, is comfortable to hold and is easy to slip into and out of your pocket.

author.name: ByZ.Wright

title: Great looking, plain yet classy!!!
body: Nice solid case, protects the phone well but isn't too bulky.  I did return it though - only because I didn't like the "feel" of it; the texture of the edges and the engraved logo on the back felt weird to me.  If you're not bothered by these things, this is an awesome case.

title: I always feel more comfortable with a case
body: A lot better than the rugged armor for the Pixel 1, but I still wish Spigen would stop it with these small camera sensor cutouts, dust is still a problem here, just like it was with the P1. Luckily, the P2's camera doesn't rely as heavily on the laser sight for focusing as the P1.

author.name: ByShafqatullah Syed

title: Nice solid case
body: Love this case.  It fits my Google Pixel 2 like a smooth, light glove.  The clear case I'd bought at Verizon was too bulky.  The black Spigen is perfect. Lightweight with a good grip.

title: A lot better than the rugged armor for the Pixel 1
body: This is not the first product I've purchased of Spigen's, but once again they've met or exceeded the standard in my book. This case keeps the same slim and sleek feel of the pixel2 while providing well rounded protection. A few details I like ; The charging port is not limited at all, the case has a matte like finish very similar to the back of the device, and the camera lens remains accessible to where it can be easily wiped free of dust.

author.name: ByL. Platt

title: Love this case
body: Nice case. I like the carbon fiber on the back. Gives it some added design. On the slimmer side. Would give good protection. I'd say it's the same size as a tech 21 case.

title: The phone has arrived!
body: This is a perfect fit for my Pixel 2.  Not bulky, adequate protection for typical use.  Make sure you use a screen protector that won't peel off from the sides when you use this case.  My last one did and I'm returning the protectors.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body: Seems generally pretty good, though it's a bit tough to hit a button at the edge of the screen because of the height of the lip -- something I think will be less noticeable after I buy and apply a tempered glass screen protector, which will raise the touch surface.

title: Great for Pixel 2
body: Love the case so far. The only drawback is that it doesn't come with a kickstand, but this case is rated much better than other cases that have a kickstand and spigen sells an attachable kickstand and that has been working great.

author.name: ByDDB

title: Good value for the money, but steep lip
body: This case is nice. Not too fat not too thin. Can squeeze sides for the Google assistant function. Has a lip to keep screen off of surface if laid down on it.

title: Great case. Can add kickstand separately
body:
Pros: Great case, very sleek design which allows it to be slim but it doesn't leave the glass on the screen nor back facing camera exposed. I have much better grip of the phone now too and am not afraid that it will slip out of my hands. Even though it doesn't have a kick stand, if you prop it against any surface the grip I mentioned allows it lean against that surface without sliding down flat. Access to the finger print scanner for Pixel ID is flawless.

Cons: none

author.name: ByAnthony Ortenzi

title: Fits great and looks good too!
body:
The case offers a snug fit and manages to make the phone much easier to grip without making it that much bigger. Unlike the
Trianium case I originally got, the buttons on here are really easy to press, almost easier than it is without the case.

Despite how it looks in pictures, the top and bottom of the back is not some cheap smooth piece of plastic glued on, it's a textured part of the rest of the case and looks/feels great in person.

title: Great case, great price, great for dads and grads
body: Works so well with my Pixel 2. Feels like it should've always been there. It's still fairly slim and less slick than the actual body of the Pixel. I like the rim around the screen (front) because it feels protected. It doesn't interfere with the finger print unlock on the back.. If anything, it makes it easier. Couldn't be happier!

Doesn't interfere with the camera, the flash, nor the finger print reader. Everything works flawlessly. Would definitely recommend!

title: Great case

Only four stars because I've had cases with better confidence (seriously, dropped my last phone down the elevator shaft of the tallest building in Indiana and it survived) and the insides of this one aren't very gummy; I'm concerned about impact survival. Still, fit and finish are excellent!

title: The phone has arrived!

All in all for the money this case offers you pretty solid protection while keeping the design of the pixel 2 in mind.

title: Five Stars
body:
I would give five stars, but the case has a hole where there does not apparently need to be one. Its the rectangular hole on the back of the case just below the led light.

UPDATE: I contacted Spigen about this and they informed me that there is indeed something there, it's just hard to see. Some kind of laser for the flash.

author.name: ByJim

title: Great case cheap
body:
The Pixel 2 is the only phone I felt like purchasing a case out of the box as the phone feels very delicate and light compared to other phones I own in the past. Normally I would purchase a case a few months after owning a phone or when cases go on sale, but decided to make an exception this time around.

Build quality of the case is very good. Phones feels more sturdier with the case on without adding much bulk/weight.

I like the textured back. Makes for a better grip on the phone.

Case is very easy to slip on-and-off like a glove. Some pressure is required so it's not going to slip off on its own

All cutouts from the USB Type-C, Microphones to light sensors on the phone are on point

Love the slope on the finger print cutout. Your finger gravitates to it very naturally and way better than the flat deign without the case, where i tend to miss press maybe 1/15 times having to re-position my hand and/or fingers

Carbon fiber is okay. Great visual appeal. Not sure why they added on both the top and bottom of the phone. Would be cool if it were only around the camera, but guess they want to keep the phone design more symmetrical?

I like how the power and volume buttons are flush with the case, so not additional grim or dust can enter. Wish there was a nub or dot on one of the buttons to get a better indicator when picking up the phone and blind pressing. This is also an issue without the case, so not going to dock it on that.

Front of the case is raised slightly, so when you have the screen down it doesn't rub against the flat surface.

Active edge, squeeze feature works with case on. Didn't have to adjust the sensitivity in the setting from what I used before

Overall, very impressed with the case as it provides better functionality and protection

title: Extra hole on back?
body:
I purchased both Spigen's "Thin Fit" and "Rugged Armor" cases. Here is my comparison:

The "Thin Fit" is definitely more streamlined and little less bulk than the "Rugged Armor", but is seems to me the "Rugged Armor" would provide better protection.

The "Thin Fit" has a smoother finish feel, while the "Rugged Armor" has a little more grip.

Since the "Rugged Armor" is more rubbery, it is much easier to remove from the phone after installed.

The finger print scanner feels like a good fit on both products.

The power and volume buttons are exposed through a cut-out on the "Thin Fit", while the "Rugged Armor" completely covers these buttons.

Overall, the "Thin Fit" is a little more slender and slicker, but I will most like stick with the ""Rugged Armor" for the better protection.

author.name: Bychris evon

title: Phone Feels More Secure
body: Instantly cracked my $40 tempered 3D glass screen protector when inserted per instructions. Will be returning. I am NOT a happy camper.

title: "Rugged Armor" vs "Thin Fit"
body:
I picked this case up for my new Pixel 2 as a direct result of the horrific battering that the Slim Armor variant for the Nexus 5 has protected my wife's phone from. My wife tends to be a clumsy person, and as a result her phone has taken some amazing trips through the air, against which the Slim Armor has been entirely and totally successful in preventing damage.

This case looks to be equally superbly made, and the carbon fiber inserts in the back add a classy touch. It fits the phone perfectly (as I would expect from Spigen) and the buttons cycle as easily as without the case. Both top and bottom microphone ports are nice and centered in the provided holes, and the charger jack is unobstructed for even large-tipped cables with plenty of cut-away distance. The squeeze-to-activate for Assistant still works flawlessly, and the cutout for the fingerprint reader neatly and comfortably guides your finger into the proper position to hit the reader every time. The bulk of the case seems about right for a light-to-mid protective one. Not enough that it stuffs out of my pocket, but enough to add just a touch of bulk and grip, and "feel" protective.

I will follow up with this review in a few months as I've put some miles on the case, but the initial impression is one of high quality and perfect fit.

author.name: ByAmazon Customer

title: I am NOT a happy camper.
body:
I've had Spigen's Rugged Armor cases on my past three phones, so I had high expectations for the new Pixel 2 Rugged Armor and pre-ordered almost immediately after placing my phone order with Google. Thankfully this iteration doesn't disappoint.

The quality of the case material is excellent and adds a nice level of grip to the sides of the phone, and all ports and sensors have ample clearance/cutouts. The corners have the same shock protection design found in other Rugged Armor cases - a welcome feature, as I've dropped phones in Rugged Armor cases on every conceivable surface and never once had damage to the phone itself. The "active edge" squeeze functionality of the Pixel 2 works perfectly with the case on as well; I'd even argue it's easier to activate now, as the case makes the phone much easier to grip and adds a nice chunky edge to squeeze! The case doesn't add much bulk at all.

For the price, you can't beat the quality and protection provided by the Rugged Armor. I'll continue to buy these cases as long as Spigen keeps making them!

title: The phone has arrived!
body: Honestly, I only bought this case to protect my phone until the Spigen Neo Hybrid got to me (it had a projected arrival date a month or more from the time I purchased my phone, and that was too risky for me).  I didn't expect much from it, so I was very pleasantly surprised, as it has exceeded my expectations.  I'm actually keeping this case and returning the Neo Hybrid (nice case, but slippery, squirts out of your hands like a bar of soap).  Now, this probably isn't the most heavy-duty protective case on the market, but I've been extremely pleased with it, especially for the price!  For a slim case I'd say it's VERY protective.  The cut-outs are perfectly aligned, active-edge works perfectly, buttons are easy to press, material of the case is firm enough to feel like phone is protected, but not stiff/brittle, the slim profile is great, and the raised lip around the screen equals YAY!  I'm still undecided if I will get another, more protective case (my last phone had the top-of-the-line Otterbox so I'm used to feeling EXTRA secure) but I really am more than pleased with this super slim Rugged Armor.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body:
Very happy with this case.
- I measured it adding 3mm to thickness of phone (with ruler, not calipers) - from 8mm without case to 11mm with case.
- Feels like it adds less thickness than similar cases I've had in the past.
- Material feels resilient enough to protect phone from most drops/dings without adding the bulk of an Otter Box type case.
- The cutout on back for fingerprint reader makes it easier for finger to find the reader.
- Exterior texture provides good grip on phone without excess drag removing from pocket
- All phone buttons work and feel good with case: squeezable side, power and volume buttons.
- Button depresses have solid, definitive feel and little or no grit.
- There is also a small raised lip to protect the screen, the camera lens is recessed (standard on all cases now I think).
- I personally like the matte black design and the small carbon fiber strips at the top or bottom.

title: Far exceeded my expectations--extremely pleased
body: This is exactly the kind of case I look for for my phones. It provides a very decent level of protection while not adding the kind of bulk that turns it into a brick. There is a tiny raised ridge that runs around the front of the phone protecting the screen adequately. The back is a good blend of protection, grip and style. The "carbon fibre" design looks good.Definitely better than it sounds. The finger print reader is quite heavily recessed, giving you a decent idea of the protection it offers. If you have enormous fingers I suppose that might be a problem. I had a very similar case on my last phone and it protected it from a couple of minor drops and a couple of bangs against wall corners while being carried. I expect this will provide equally good protection based on my first few days with it. I don't use a screen protector as I've not found one necessary with glass improvements and this kind of raised-edge protection. If you're looking for a tank-like case this probably isn't for you. If you're looking a for great protection at a great price with minimal bulk addition to the phone, you won't find a much better case than this. Highly recommended.

author.name: ByKathryn

title: Nice and slim case, provides adequate protection and nice feel in hand
body:
Fits perfectly, looks and feels great. However, my screen cracked at it's first fall with this case. It's was a 3ft fall, landed face down. This cover did not provide a barrier for the screen.

I've had numerous similar drops with previous phones and a Commuter series OtterBox with no issues. Unfortunately no OtterBox is available for the regular Pixel 2. Turns out this is not a good alternative.

title: Perfect blend of protection/minimal bulk
body:
I decided for once to get a case for my phone before I had dropped the phone and dented it or scratched the paint or anything, but when I was ready to order one most cases were unavailable or didn't have reviews. I have this case on my Nexus 6P, though, and I had good experiences with it there so I decided to take the chance with this one. It seems like a pretty solid case that should do well to protect the phone. All the ports are there, and there is ample space for them, so no blockage issues. I have no issues with activating Active Edge (the squeeze feature) with the case on, and if anything it's probably a little easier to do since there's a little more grip and a material to squeeze. The fingerprint port continues to feel like an improvement over the bare phone since it guides you to the sensor and makes it less vague where the sensor is, though it does make it a little bit harder to use the fingerprint sensor swipe (for pulling down the notifications/quick access). There is a raised lip for the front so if you put the phone face down, the glass isn't going to touch the surface, which is really nice.

There are a few things to be aware of with the case though. While the ports have ample space, they are apparently aligned slightly off-center from what they're allowing access for. The bottom microphone, for example, is right about on the top of the port (the microphone hole isn't blocked at all though), rather than centered, and the top microphone has a similar but less pronounced offset. Likewise, the port for the fingerprint sensor is slightly offset low and left, so top right edge of the sensor is about equal with the port while there's a bit of excess space beyond the sensor to the bottom left. None of these affect performance, so it's more of a small detail that just irritates a person who likes things to be centered, level, etc. The buttons for the case work fine, though they're not fully enclosed; there are small gaps above and below (or to the sides, depending on how you're looking at it). I tell myself they're for helping water drain or something, but what it seems most likely is that they'll allow some dust and small particles in there. I also wish the separation of the volume up and volume down buttons was a little more defined. I hate volume rockers and much prefer individual buttons, so I like this case because it essentially turns a rocker into buttons, but they're separated and individually defined a little better on my 6P case compared to this one. The carbon fibre inserts look nice, but they're also recessed/the majority of the case bulges out some. This is actually kind of good because it means if you put the phone down on its back, the camera isn't touching the surface (assuming a hard, flat surface like a desk) at all, so you're less likely to accidentally scratch the glass. However, this also seems like the case adds a little more bulk than is maybe necessary (not bad for me since I like my phones to feel substantial). And finally, the case is pretty snug, which isn't necessarily bad but it does mean the phone is a little bit tough to get into the case, and I worry that I might accidentally scratch the phone trying to get it in or out.

I did order a tempered glass screen protector but it's not here yet, so I don't know how well the case will work with that, but if you don't have a screen protector on, it's a really solid case. There are enough nitpicks for me to give it a 4 instead of 5 star rating, but nothing so bad that I wouldn't highly recommend the case.

author.name: BySean

title: Good look and fit, poor protection for drops.
body:
I normally hate cases, but after buying Nexus phones for years this Pixel 2 is by far the most I've spent on a phone in a while, so I wanted to keep it safe. I wanted something that would provide ample protection but not bulk up the phone too much, and looking through Spigen's offerings I thought that this one would be the one for me.

Turned out that this case is exactly what I wanted - it's lightweight and fits perfectly, but it's thick enough to actually cushion falls, and has a bit of a lip over the edge of the screen so that the corners won't ever hit the ground. The material is like a hard rubber, it's not clingy/sticky like some cheap rubber cases are, but it's not brittle plastic either. The buttons are well made and feel great. I'm not crazy about the random carbon fiber accent but it's reasonable IMO. You do get some dust collecting around the edges but I think that's true for any case. Active Edge still works, but you may need to adjust the sensitivity - mine has always been a little finicky if I use my palm, though it's better if I use a finger on each side, but the case doesn't seem to make it noticeably worse.

Overall, great case for the price (and in general)! Cases in this price range are usually mushy and weird but this one is perfect.

title: Great case with a few design quirks
body:
This is a fantastic case. It's soft rubber so it slides easily in/out of my pocket.It fits the phone snugly. It's also really slim, doesn't add weight or bulk to the phone.

THE BEST FEATURE: the button covers for the volume control actually improve the volume controls because you can feel the notch where the up/down keys are. I wish Google cut a notch on the volume keys. I have a hard time with it without the case.

The screen-side cover pushes up against my screen protector creating air bubbles. I have to just use my finger nail to move the cover over the screen protector. It's not a big deal though.

I had a Spigen cover for my Nexus 5x so I had to get this one for my Pixel 2. Best cover IMO!

author.name: ByNibberJammies

title: I normally hate cases, but after buying Nexus phones for years ...
body:
Love it! Buttons are so clicky. Seriously! I'm able to double click power button so easily to get into camera. Number 1 reason I went with a pixel 2 (quick camera) just got quicker with the clicky button! Case I'm reviewing this relative to is the thin live case (which looked great but felt bad in most ways)

Pros:
Looks good and sleek
Feels good
Fingerprint sensor cutout feels really good and allows gliding on the sensor to pull down notification shade without issues
Buttons! So clicky, very satisfying feel!
Matte finish, love it
Feels very protective without adding too much size
Very good fit
Squeezey works fine

Cons:
Very black slab-ish, not a lot of flair, carbon fiber highlights are nice though.
Case could be more grippy, but compared to live case it's super grippy

title: This is a fantastic case. It's soft rubber so it slides easily ...
body: This case fits perfectly on the new Pixel 2 (5 inch). I just got the phone in today, and it couldn't be a better fit. The case feels durable and sturdy. This phone is great, but i immediately noticed it was succetable to scratches and quick wear and tear. This case will definitely prolong the integrity and look of the new Pixel. Well done Spigen.

author.name: ByRichard T

title: Buttons so clicky, double click to camera never felt so quick
body: Nice case. Goes on easily and the holes line up perfectly, it also comes off easily. One thing I've noticed is it does collect a lot of dust around the edges, which other have said. I didn't think I would notice but you can definitely see dust collecting, easy to wipe away but it's odd that it happens. I can also say that it does protect the phone. I dropped my phone on the tile floor while putting it in my pocket and the phone took the fall without issue. That's the most important thing and it stood up to being dropped.

title: The phone has arrived!
body: Looks like its doing its job well and protecting my phone. Most phones these days are too big to fit comfortably in my small palms (or tiny pockets in women's jeans) and I regularly drop them. I like the rubbery grip on this case and the fact that it covers the phone on all the edges. Obviously this takes away from the overall look of the phone but I am willing to sacrifice that for safety. I am not a big fan of the carbon fiber design features on the back and would have preferred plain design throughout.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body:
Fits well, very light weigh, clean and understand look. . I did have to increase the squeeze pressure to activate Google assistant to it's highest, the extra grip make it easier to activate.

Only ding which doesn't merit reducing a star, opposite end of the bottom mic, is a small divot, likely where the mold injects.

title: Good protection, not very elegant looking
body:
It's a nice thin and seemingly durable case. I highly doubt the military grade drop test part of the advertising, but whatever. I'm all about bumper cases - thin things that just let me lay a phone down flat on a table without touching the screen and giving cover for corners if a phone falls to the ground.

This seems to mostly do that very well with one exception - it collects a lot of dust in places. I must note that I do not have a screen protector as I'm careful with my devices and never liked the feel. I get a lot of dust gathering along the top of the phone, as well as the small camera sensor cutout beneath the flash.

I'm really just worried about the camera sensors beneath the flash. I think cutting out the tiny sliver of case between the flash and sensors might help or there seems to be quite a few similar alternative cases made that way that could avoid the issue.

author.name: ByAD

title: Fits well, very light weigh, clean and understand ...
body:
This case is light and yet very well made. It fits snugly and offers a great deal of protection as far as I can tell. I feel confident that I could drop my phone and it would be just fine!
The case lines up perfectly so it doesn't obstruct the fingerprint sensor or camera. The case also does not obstruct the Google Assistant "Squeezey-sides" function. I use this function a lot and have not had an issue regardless of the case covering the phone. Definitely worth the price :)

title: Sturdy, slim fitting dust collector
body:
I received this case prior to receiving the phone, so I'll update once I slide the device into the case.

Spigen products are known for being precision fit and of high quality. This TPU case seems in line with that reputation.

I do wish I had known that there were "slots" on the long sides of the volume and power buttons and that the buttons are not *fully* covered. I hate that since I pocket carry and my phone is prone to picking up pocket lint.

author.name: ByBen

title: Great case! Lightweight and protective
body: This is an amazing case by Spigen. The cutouts are precise, the matte finish is satisfying to hold and blends right in with the rest of the phone. The carbon fiber accents are appealing and the bottom indentation is a good place to rest your pinky finger when using the phone one-handed. I only wish the front lip was slightly bigger but it would add more bulk to the phone. As it is now this is one of the slimmest cases you can find, while still providing more protection than sub-10$ TPU cases.

title: Spigen Rugged Armor for the Pixel 2 -- a quality and precision cut case that should provide great protection!
body: This is the perfect case for me and my Pixel 2. It feels great in my hand, is very sexy and sleek, and definitely protects my phone well. It fits quite snugly and the buttons still work extremely well. I honestly don't feel comfortable handling my Pixel 2 without it. The case also makes it easier to grip the phone while using the "squeeze" function and the fingerprint sensor on the back.

author.name: ByJ. Malinowski

title: A perfect case
body:
Very good case for the Pixel 2 (2017). Fits well and the buttons are easy to access and use. Also, for those wondering, the active edge feature (squeeze to activate the assistant) works well with this case. I've had no issues and don't have to squeeze extra hard.

The case keeps the screen from touching the table when you set it down, and does the same for the back side camera. Seems like this case will protect the phone well. Would buy it again if I had a second Pixel 2.

title: Perfect Case
body:
I've not used a phone case before because some are so bulky. This case fits my Pixel 2 perfectly and you can barely tell it's there. The buttons seem appropriately responsive despite being covered.

Another concern was that it would pick up lint from my pants pocket. That doesn't happen.

Does it protect my phone from a drop? I hope to never find out!

author.name: ByKaorikaze

title: Very good case for the Pixel 2 (2017)
body:
The Rugged Armor case for the Pixel 2 is a perfect fit, looks/feels great and allows for easy use of all the Pixel 2 functions. The case fit easily, yet snug, around the Pixel 2 and I was very impressed with the quality/look of the case on the phone.

Function: The case is a perfect fit for the power button and the volume control buttons. It feels to me like I must use slightly more pressure, but it is certainly not an issue and, as I think about it, may even be a positive since the buttons have less chance of being inadvertently pressed. Also, the "Active Edge" function works fine; maybe slightly more pressure is needed, but not a bad thing in my opinion. I've taken a number of pictures with the case on and have not noticed any impact to the photos. There is an imperceptible variance (nit-picking here) with the cut out for the fingerprint sensor; however, it has no impact on the function of that sensor (use it all the time). I use my phone to stream music while working out and this case allows me to slide it into my pockets easily.

Protection: I have no intention of conducting any drop tests, so I'll update when/if that ever happens. Given my history, unfortunately, I'll have some experience soon enough. In the meantime, the case feels like it adds sufficient protection from bumps, scrapes and drops. The raised edges provides protection to the screen while also protecting the camera face.

Looks: Although this is really a personal preference on what one likes, having the black case on the black phone, I think it looks great. The back is smooth, with the carbon fiber and gloss detailing at the top and bottom of the back giving it a rich look.

title: The phone has arrived!
body: I was a little concerned, going from an OtterBox with an older iPhone to a new case with a brand new phone. After the heft of the OtterBox, this case seemed worryingly thin when I opened it and put it on, but I've dropped the phone a few times now, and there's no damage or problems with the phone, so my concerns are gone.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body:
Great fit and provides a good grip. I like the fact that when I'm pushing buttons, I'm pressing on the casing and not on the phone's buttons themselves.
I bought this case with the iSTOYO screen protector. I wouldn't use this protective "film" with this case. The case fits really well, and it bunches up the screen protector. Maybe a glass screen protector would work better than one comprised of film.

title: Looks good, does the job well.
body: The case works as advertised. It is smooth on the back side and can slide around on surfaces which i could not tell from any review.  It's not a bad thing but I guess I expected it to have more friction so surfaces. All the cutouts fit perfectly so there's no problem there. It has very little to the bulk of the phone.  Active edge feature works great with case on.

author.name: ByLyssandra

title: Great fit and provides a good grip
body:
Fits perfectly with precision; squeeze function works flawlessly; all around drop protection with no added bulk or clumsiness. I love this case - so far it's made for an even better experience with my new Pixel 2!

Update! (12/5/17): Alright, so. I have accidentally dropped my Pixel 2 with this case at least twice, onto coarse stone concrete... absolutely no worries whatsoever. In fact, I have removed the case for routine cleaning and have noticed that, despite it's wonderfully solid, minimalist, aluminum/glass design, I prefer using my phone with this case! You get just the right amount of grip/surface tension with this case, without feeling tacky, flimsy, or of poor quality.

title: Perfect fit.
body: This case fits my Pixel 2 great and seems to provide a decent amount of protection without a lot of added bulk. I don't tend to drop by phone, so I haven't really tested it out. However, I like the way the case feels in my hand, and makes it easier to grip the phone while using it. The case is well made and does not inhibit the use of any of the phone's features. It also does not get in the way of the screen protector (film, not glass) that I have on the phone. This is a great case, especially for the price!

author.name: Bygreatlegs

title: Just buy it!
body: I bought this case for my 14 year old's new pixel 2 phone. He worked for 6 months to earn the money to buy himself a new phone. I let him pick out the case. The case was ordered on a Sunday morning and delivered on Monday afternoon. He opened the package, put the case on his phone and within minutes dropped the phone on the driveway. The phone survived the 3 foot drop on to concrete without a scratch. It was a great teaching moment on the importance of protecting valuables.

title: Great case!
body:
Like it a lot - seems to provide good protection without adding too much bulk to the phone.
all buttons work well through the case & fingerprint reader still works well.
Just got it, so I will report back at a later date, after I have had it for a while, but for now I am very happy for $13.

author.name: Bydnelson

title: The case saved the phone within minutes of being installed.
body: needed an inexpensive case that didn't add a lot of bulk and protected the phone from drops and falls. This was exactly that. Nothing special or flashy and exactly as described. Would recommend if you don't like putting expensive ultra box cases on your phone that pretty much hide the entire thing. Sure those add more protection but I just don't like those. This works just fine for what I wanted and needed. Would like to have seen more colors since my white phone looks pretty much completely black both sides now but it's got a good grip and I don't feel like I'm going to drop it every time I use it.

title: Good value - appears to offer fair protection with minimal bulk
body: Do not get this case if you have screen protector. I already went through 2 protectors and not junk ones either and neither lasted even a week. The edge of the case pushes up on the edges of the protector and I broke my glass protector today.

author.name: ByJeremy Cooper

title: exactly what I wanted
body: Love this brand. This particular case fits like a glove.very comparable to the other spigen case I use (the clear one in the pic) in terms of fit. This company does an amazing job making sure the cutouts are precise and the buttons are easy to press. I'm very satisfied.

title: The phone has arrived!
body: I typically like a thicker case, but I decided to try something a little slimmer this time.  The case itself is a breeze to install and adds just the right amount of thickness to my Pixel 2 XL.  I tend to place my phones face down which you can do with this case since it's raised a bit over the screen.  This ensures that the screen itself is not touching the surface that your phone is sitting on.  Assuming of course that it's a flat surface.

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body: I really like this case. It's got a very minimalist design which is very much my taste. It's almost like the phone is not even in a case, except that it has a slightly grippy texture (but not so grippy that it won't easily slip into your pocket). The case also seems to be immune to lint, unlike my previous case that was more rubbery. Phone slipped very easily into the case yet seems to fit nice and snug.

title: I like it
body: Love this case, fits perfectly with my Pixel 2 and everything works as expected.  I also like the look and feel of the case.  It has enough grip so it's not slippery when holding it but it's NOT too grippy because it easily slides into my pocket.  Active edge works well with this case and the buttons are still clicky.  No issues with pictures or videos.  It lays flat and has raised edges on the front to protect the screen.  I wished it had a sturdy kickstand like some other more expensive cases from Spigen but other than that I love this case!

author.name: ByMike B.

title: Nice minimalist style
body: I am extremely happy with this case for my Pixel 2. The fit is perfect - it feels sturdy, but it's thin enough that it doesn't make the phone feel huge or interfere with the buttons or the squeeze feature. The cutout for the fingerprint sensor has a beveled edge that makes it accessible and comfortable to use.

title: Highly recommend this case!  Quality product!
body: I've been using Spigen cases for my last few phones, and have enjoyed all of them. This case is no exception. This one is slim, but still solid. Most importantly, the button response is great; no mush or loss of contact. Highly recommended.

author.name: Bykclubta1

title: Fantastic case!
body:
I like the case, as it has a good feel to it and looks great. Does not make the phone too bulky.

The one thing I didn't like is that it doesn't work well with a tempered glass protector. I couldn't get the lip of the case uniformily around the tempered glass. Definitely not after considering a magnet for mounting the phone in my car. Not sure if I'm going to send it back yet.

title: Another great Spigen case.
body: Was looking for a thin case with good protection for my new Pixel 2 and this one fit the bill perfectly. I didn't give it a full 5 stars as the back is still really slick and can make holding the phone with one hand precarious. It would have been great to have a slightly more grippy surface on the back. Overall though I would highly recommend this case, its one of the best for the pixel 2 if you don't want to spend $40... cough cough google...

author.name: ByMatthew Ritzman

title: Great case, but watch out if you use tempered glass protector.
body: I previously had the top brand protective case on my old phone. The case was $39 four years ago. This new case is almost identical to that one. The fit, finish, and quality are astounding. The level of protection is comparable to the big name brand slim case that's 4 times the price.It adds virtually no bulk to the phone, is very cushioned, and has a grip texture but easily slides in and out of your pocket. And, the carbon fiber insets give it a high end look I highly recommend this case for the Pixel 2!

title: Great case, but with one flaw
body:
Fits really good. Turns out some people complain that the Pixel 2 volume buttons are very tough when pursuing then (I'm one of those). Having the case alleviates the issue just a tad.

Having the fingerprint sensor recessed into the case was weird at the beginning, but after a few minutes I didn't notice that anymore.

author.name: ByC. Mecklenborg

title: Excellent Pixel 2 Case at excellent Price
body: Delivered quickly, sturdy case, and nice look. I've used a Spigen case for my last two phones and recently upgraded to the Pixel 2 knowing exactly which case I wanted. Spigen is a very well known brand that makes some great cases. I like that the case is sturdy without becoming bulky (like many of the Otter Box cases). I have dropped my previous phone a handful of times and the case has protected it against each fall. I'm confident that this case will work exactly the same way.

title: The phone has arrived!
body:
I purchased this product for my father's Pixel 2. His feed back was extremely positive. He came from an LG G4 and switching to a Pixel 2 was a huge upgrade. Adding this case was the cherry on top.

When equipped, the feel in hand is very solid and great to the touch. The material does not make the device slippery at all. My father said that the carbon fiber is a very nice design and make's the phone look "tactical".

I have been a long time customer of Spigen and expect no less from them. Great product!

title: The case feels sturdy enough, like it would get the job done
body: Nice case at a reasonable price. My only issue with it is that it doesn't have a magnet in the cover to trigger the phone to turn the screen off. Most wallet-style cases have this feature, but it's missing here.

title: Spigen back at it again with quality cases!
body: I have never had a problem with my spigen cases.  This one fit way better then the knockoff i bought when i my phone was a pre-sale.  Nice cut lines and all the mics, camera and buttons all line up.

title: Nice case at a reasonable price

It still allows you to squeeze the phone and activate your Google Assistant and the phone still functions well. The reason why I did four stars is I broke two glass screen protectors trying to use this case. I don't know if it was because of the case or the protectors.

carbon fiber accents are a bit odd but they look better in person than i expected, for $13 my expectations have been exceeded.

Low profile design fits well in hand, feels like a premium case.

I ordered a $10 case last week that didn't fit at all from a different company. this one is def worth the extra $3 and with prime shipping it came quick!

Only thing keeping it from being a 5/5 is that the case is more on the slippery side and can fall out of your hand more easily.

author.name: Bywillonious

title: Nice Case but...
body: The case fits the phone well, looks good, adds very little bulk, and allows access to all inputs and controls. In fact, the fingerprint reader seems more effective with the case - I suspect the slight depth forces my finger to hit the reader in the right place more consistently. The case also makes the phone feel more secure in my hand. It's the first phone case I've used - I always thought they were clunky and ugly. This one's nice!

author.name: ByUriel V.

title: Great fit and comfort
body: I've only had to case a few days. The Google Pixel 2 (GP2) as an user knows when you buy, its light weight and you feel like you are going to break it by breathing on it. So the case protects the glass very well with a nice carbon finish. The case fits like a glove around the phone with the matte finish giving it some extra grip ability. The functions of the phone are not impeded (camera, buttons, finger reader, and squeeze). I have not dropped it yet, (knock on wood). But looking at the hardened rubber that gives a .5 or less raise to the front from a direct face plant...I would feel ok dropping it lightly from my desk. As long as its a direct fall and not a multi strike to the ground. As a backup I have the insurance with Google.

title: Not as sturdy feeling as I was hoping for
body: So far I've only had this case for a few days but it's served it's purpose well. The edges come up over the screen giving it a little protection if dropped screen first (even though I still would recommend a screen protector). The outline by the camera doesn't inhibit the camera in any way and the same can be said for the fingerprint scanner. It took a little to get used to using it with the case but within an hour or 2 I was already used to it. So far the phone feels easier to hold and like I'm less likely to drop it so that's good.

body:

I don't think it will do much protecting in the case of an impact. I've bought $8 cases off of amazon that seem tougher but I will wait until the phone gets here and update my review then.

title: Not compatible with Google Pixel 2 XL.
body:
The screen picture appears a little washed out but is useable.
The camera has led lights (as stated in the product description), but these are just that, LED lights and not IR lights, so if you want to run the camera all the time, it will be showing a (quite bright) light to the rear. I guess this is why the power plug (cigar lighter type) has an on/off button on it. It does not wire into reverse, but one has to turn it on and off each time it is used.
The camera has distance lines which show up on the screen, and which can be useful.
The camera bracket does not allow for lateral movement, just vertical up and down movement
The camera bracket had to be modified a little as the camera bracket would not tighten down . The screen is exactly the same although it did tighten a little better. This tends to restrict where the display can be placed as it cannot be directed towards the driver at an angle.
Plenty of cable supplied but it is a 4 pin DIN-type socket and not the usual 5 pin. For me this was a nuisance as I have a better camera, with IR, but it has a 5 pin connector.
For the money, I believe the item is worth it for a fairly trouble-free instal without having to break into the car wiring or reversing switch.

author.name: Byjbt
